Reviews.Title: “Great accommodation close to Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Mangion
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay at the Medina Classic. Location was excellent in close proximity to restaurants and the Redfern Train Station is a short 5 minute walk away. We had a 2 bedroom apartment on the 1st floor at the rear of the premises. Apartment was well furnished and had everything we needed for our weekend stay. Reception staff extremely courteous. Will definitely stay here again when next in Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Repeated Issues”
Reviews.Author: KleinerYoyo
Reviews.Content: Booked only for one night and have a guess whats happened...again the fire alarm went off, lucky not in the middle of the night this time as with other guests. The Hotel is in need of some refurbishing, some chipped furniture, it was clean. Would not give a 4 Star rating, rather a good 3 Star

Reviews.Title: “good for a quick one nighter”
Reviews.Author: Mealzybug
Reviews.Content: We booked a two bedroom apartment to stay one night to see a concert in Newtown. The location isn't great if you want to be close to the city but it had easy accesss tothe redfern train station. I wouldn't stay here if you didn't know your way around Sydney. The rooms were average and the windows didn't have any fly screens on them so you couldn't keep them open. The courtyard was very loud through the walls and the room smelt damp. It had a reasonable size kitchen and tv's in every room but the bathroom was much too small. The people at the front counter were friendly and helpful though and through wotif we got free parking underground and late check out at 12 so if you need somewhere to stay for one night where you just need to sleep and shower, this place isn't too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and location, pity about the noise and loss of property”
Reviews.Author: Mishnin79
Reviews.Content: We had a two bedroom apartment booked in early February. The apartment was lovely and the staff were initially very helpful. The first night we were woken by the fire alarm at 2am with no instruction from staff, but after seeking advice were told it was a false alarm and then people very loudly used the pool until 5am with no one telling them to leave. During the day we left and upon our return, we noticed a handbag missing. We searched and other valuables were there but the whole handbag was gone. I reported it to reception. They called the next morning to advise that the cleaner did not have it. When we said we would be reporting it to police, I was told they would check again, but again to no avail. Upon checkout we spoke to the manager who seemed very dismissive. Eventually they agreed to make a police report. We were then called to say that not one cleaner as per originally stated but two cleaners had cleaned our apartment and the second cleaner noticed a door open. The treatment by the manager was quite poor and it was an unfortunate way to end the weekend. The goods were never recovered.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service, clean spacious apartment”
Reviews.Author: Marvin13
Reviews.Content: I recently booked a one bedroom room here and was upgraded automatically to a two-bedroom. The apartment was very clean, nicely laid out, private and secure. It was a little bit shabby in very minor ways - a few tatty powerpoints, that sort of thing - but I felt very comfortable.The staff were really nice and helpful in every way. Secure undercover parking was important to me, and access to the apartment was internal and straightforward. The cooktop scenario is a bit funny; there are a whole lot of instructions about not only putting the rangehood onto full but having to open the sliding glass door across the room (in order to not set off smoke alarms). It also would have been nicer to have a mini bar option; fortunately there are plenty of food and shopping options nearby in Glebe, Newtown and Annandale, and there's also a cafe attached to the hotel/apartments (though it's a daytime sort of thing I think). The bed was really comfortable; there was a wall mounted tv in the second bedroom that has single beds, but not one in the main bedroom. In any case, with wireless internet for what I thought was a reasonable fee, I could watch ABC iView anywhere in the apartment which was great (and good because no pay tv or pay movies in-house). All in all, I enjoyed my stay and would definitely stay again, either in business or family mode. With my iPad :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great apartment , friendly service”
Reviews.Author: apalmer68
Reviews.Content: I was attending a seminar at University of Sydney , so this location was perfect for me . Excellent service , very nice clean room ( 1BR unit ) , comfy bed , quiet , in a nice neighbourhood . Only 10 min walk to King St for amazing shops & resturants.

Reviews.Title: “"Good place to stay"”
Reviews.Author: Jan C
Reviews.Content: Good location close to train station and shopping at Broadway Centre. Restaurants close by. Nice and quiet away from hustle and bustle. Staff were extremely helpful. Nice 2 bedroom apartment. TV's in both bedrooms and 1 in lounge. Very clean, but needs new beds. Mattresses sloped. Internet very expensive. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: trav060
Reviews.Content: Well kept contemporary accomodation. Friendly / helpful staff. 2 tvs in apartments . although more cable channels would be great. Close to the city centre without the crowds. Best housekeeping around. Parking very reasonable at only $ 10.00 pn. Will stay there again and again.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Delhielhi, National Capital Territory of Delhi, India
Reviews.Title: “Homely place with average facilities”
Reviews.Author: subramanyan_nv
Reviews.Content: I booked this place for staying in Sydney as, unfortunately for me, no other place was available at the time I travelled. That said the place was quite homely. Price-wise, it is on the relatively expensive side, considering the ambience and the facilities it provides. The food is average but the perceptive and friendly service provided stands out. The room I had was compact with an old TV. The garden is small with an even smaller swimmin pool, but it is indeed a relaxing and quiet place while also being close to the underground. All said and done, I would say the place is good but could definitely be cheaper for the facilities it provides.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Disappointed160959
Reviews.Content: Great apartments great location friendly staff, very cozy, well worth a stay

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Wonderful, Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: breann_888
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel numerous times and will continue to do so. The hotel is located on a backstreet which is an easy walk to the Uni of Sydney, broadway shopping centre and redfern. It is also close to bus stops and the redfern station is you want to go into the city. The rooms are always spotless and modernly furnished as well as being spacious. You are always greeted with a smile from the staff and the small cafe on the corner has great food. All in all, a fine establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the dollars”
Reviews.Author: clairemickan
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything I had hoped for during my stay in Sydney with friends. It was clean, the apartment had enough cooking utensils and the service was excellent. The location was only a short walk from the train station that got us everywhere we needed to go, and it's location in relation to Broadway Shopping Centre was very convenient. The only issue was the toilet did not flush every single time we used it, it would need an hour or so to refresh itself, but we reported this to management and they said they would look into it. I would be happy to pay the higher rates throughout the New Year, as we did, but I think the normal rates compliment the hotel facilities very nicely. I will definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: vmmo
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my daughter (12) and son (15) who was attending a workshop at Sydney uni. It could not have been a better location. The 2 bedroom apartment had everything we needed, spacious, clean, comfortable, great kitchen and fantastic staff. Very friendly and professional. Obviously the area suited our needs on this occasion but wanted to write anyway because I was 100% happy...often I am not!

Reviews.Title: “Variable: good and bad bits”
Reviews.Author: otagotraveller
Reviews.Content: This is a difficult place to rate, in some ways. It's wonderfully located for the university, close to King Street shops and restaurants, and a short walk to the Redfern station to catch a train all over the city. There's a farmer's market just around the corner. We had a great big one-bedroom apartment which was spacious and comfortable, although a little tatty in places and needed a bit of TLC. (The towels were fraying at the edges, a hole in the bathroom ceiling, grubby carpet). The worst aspect was the bed: a roller-coaster of a thing which combined a slope, a hump in the middle, and a few dodgy springs. Oh, and severe sleep turbulence - my partner would move a muscle and the whole thing would shake violently. The hotel urgently needs a bed replacement programme - I've slept in much better beds in backpackers'. Oh, and don't rely on the taxi ordering service on your in-room telephone: I waited 40 minutes for a taxi that never turned up, despite the best efforts of the very helpful chap on reception to chase it up for me with the taxi company. The cafe on the ground floor is very good for food, although it, too, could use a good scrub and a new coat of paint. The bedroom windows of one room - #2 - face on to the cafe's tiny, closed-in courtyard, and I'd avoid that room like the plague. Apart from all these things, this place is OK, you could certainly do worse.

Reviews.Title: “Good staff, good location, terrible bed”
Reviews.Author: rat1512
Reviews.Content: The staff were great, the location was fine and the size of the room was excellent. BUT they need to throw away the bed. It was hard on one side, and the springs had given out on the other. We could see that it sloped. The room needed a repaint to remove all the cracks and scuff marks. Lots of other little things which really bring down my over all rating. It appeared they didn't check anything â€¢ 1 of the ceiling lights in the lounge didnâ€™t work â€¢ The desk lamp didnâ€™t work, the transformer was broken and looked hazardous â€¢ There was no radio/CD player â€¢ The bath plug was too big for the plug hole â€¢ The bathroom window frame was filthy â€¢ The bathroom window ledge paint had worn off and was down to bare wood in places â€¢ There was a big hole in the ceiling next to one of the ceiling lights in the bathroom â€¢ The TV remote control was filthy â€¢ Other guests were extremely noisy on the Saturday night. I complained at 2:10am, but the noise was still going at 3:30. This should have been shut down a lot earlier â€¢ The toilet paper was not replenished and we ran out on the last day â€¢ The cost of extra milk and laundry powder is excessive at $4.50 each. Surely, they can still make some profit and offer guests the convenience of this service

Reviews.Title: “like a episode of lost”
Reviews.Author: col5353
Reviews.Content: As a hotel its fine, but trying to get there was a nightmare for the taxi driver. Located in the middle of a residential area its a typical Sydney rabbit warren of streets to get in and out of - made worse by a number of closed roads due to work being done. Other than that the location is great, 30 min walk into the heart of the city (this was after 9pm on a Sat night). Close to a train station, and major arterial roads. Room, as on the ground floor, which was great as our bags were heavy, however the luggage trolley doesnt fit through the door to the courtyard. Inside its as much a rabbit warren as the streets it is located in. For a short stay it was fine, I did find the bed soft, and the TV hadnt been cleaned in what looked like months. But the shower was good. Taxi back to the airport arrived at the Medina within minutes of booking. Overall, its was Ok, but next trip I'll try a different Medina.

Reviews.Title: “scared to go out!”
Reviews.Author: sarahwickford
Reviews.Content: As we had never been to Australia before we relied completely on our agent to book our sydney accomadation for us, considering we were traveling with four young children over the new year period we expected to be in a safe, easily acsessable area - this unfortunately did not happen!! The medina chippendale is a clean, well presented, adequately sized accomadation which is in a very undesireable area.We spent 5 nights in a 3 bedroom appartment over new year which was very exspensive and should have left us with alot of happy memories but instead it left us feeling scared and intimidated every time we went out.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of their internet access”
Reviews.Author: rsling
Reviews.Content: It is a nice hotel and a plesant place to stay however DON'T use their internet access. They ive you a wireless router and you have to install some software from a CD. This giggered my PC to the deree that I had to reinstall my entire hard disk. They need to get a better way of accessing the net.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: albertst
Reviews.Content: Really a pleasant place to stay. We were upgraded to a 2 bedroom apartment, very roomy and looking over a pretty courtyard, quiet and fresh room. Easy walk to buses to city centre, a $12 cab ride back.Very close to Redfern, (parts are a no go area) but walk in the right direction and feel secure as it's close to Sydney University too, it's very safe in the daytime, walked past hundreds of students in the streets! Extremely pleasant and helpful reception staff. We'll stay here again, a good experience

Reviews.Title: “Nice apartment, but terrible towels!!”
Reviews.Author: Sulman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Medina Chippendale in January. Our two-bedroom apartment was clean, modern and attractively decorated. The male reception staff were very friendly and most polite and helpful with our requests for various things. The location in back streets near the University was quiet - no obvious street noise, or train noise (it's not far from the railway line). It was a quick train ride from Redfern Station into all the major attractions of Sydney, but Redfern itself is not a nice area and we wouldn't have been happy to walk back to the apartment from the station at night. However, it was very easy and inexpensive to get a taxi from the city, even on Australia Day, so this didn't create any problems for us. A couple of negatives: a spot of blood (not ours!) on one of the duvet covers which was immediately changed at our request. The other was the towels! They were supposed to be white, but were verging on grey and they didn't smell particularly clean. I doubt if they had been washed on a boil cycle and even when we asked for clean towels (which were promptly delivered) these were the same. New towels all round and a hot wash would make all the difference!

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fine”
Reviews.Author: JenniferBendigo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while attending a conference at the University of Sydney.( Professional woman travelling solo) At no time did I feel unsafe and while it is close to Redfern, Sydney friends reassured me that it is in the "safe" side of this area. I loved the cafe next door , the narrow streets, the local people and the Thai restaurant down the street. The staff were delightful, and the accommodation extremely comfortable. My family occasionally use other Medina apartments in Melbourne and Sydney. My recommendations for this property would include an upgrade of the gym and in house movies . However, I would stay here again as it is easily accessible by train or taxi. Take a map if travelling by train as most people that I asked directions from, didn't know where to go!

Reviews.Title: “Not for the insecured”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Despite ringing to confirm bookings twice, we were told on two seperate occassions that there was one bathroom plus one ensuite in our 2 bedroom apartment. On arrival, we found that there was only one bathroom between four people. This room is also suppose to accommodate up to 5 guests. Requests for 4 single beds that was also confirmed turned out to be two doubles beds. As it was peak Easter season, we were advised that there were no other rooms and was not able to find alternate accommodation. Windows in both bedrooms had winding handles, and although a key and button was available, the windows did not lock. There are rusted metal bars, but looked easily detachable given a shake or two. The pool is a 25m toe dipper and the gym had a treadmill as the sole piece of equipment. There is however a lovely cafe that is part of the hotel. If you are travelling alone, keep in mind that this hotel is located inside a maze of little streets, and although we did not see any incidents, I would be weary to walk through the streets at night. Having your own transportation is highly recommended. Good luck getting out of the car park if you have a manual car as there is a very steep driveway. Our swipe cards were also very tempermental when trying to enter and exit the carpark. We also walked into a spider web dodging parked cars to access walkways. If you have a fair amount of luggage, you may want to enquire about a room that can easily access lifts, as there are "back door" tunnels to each section of the hotel. Dragging over 80kg of items between us through 2 sets of narrow winding stairs was not particularly amusing. Overall, staff were poliet but were unable to assist us. Requests such as extra doona's and towels were slow. It was cheaper than city based apartments that offered the same features, however I would rather pay the extra $50 a night instead in future.

Reviews.Title: “adorable staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i usually stay at Medina's across Sydney but after staying at Medina Classic Chippendale in Sydney i decided to make that my number 1 destination in Sydney. The property was quite new abd there isnt a word that can describe how wonderfull their staff was, especially one of the young men at reception who welcomed me and my family very kindly and made our stay very comfortable there. The only thing that is not good about the property is the location which is around the corner from Redfern, but all else very good.

HotelInfo.Name: Medina Classic Chippendale
HotelInfo.Address: 74-80 Ivy Street | Chippendale, Sydney, New South Wales 2008, Australia
